    • Method Detail

      • takeTurn

        public void takeTurn()
        Handles the AI player's full turn. Also prints debug info if debug mode is active.
        Overrides:
        takeTurn in class Player

      • doTurnActions

        public void doTurnActions()
        Executes the full sequence of the AI's actions during their turn.
        Overrides:
        doTurnActions in class Player

      • useAbility

        protected void useAbility()
        Executes the AI's character-specific ability and purple card abilities.
        Overrides:
        useAbility in class Player

      • canUseArmoryNow

        public boolean canUseArmoryNow()
        Determines whether the player can use the Armory's ability this turn. Armory can only be used if the player has less than the city size limit, and there is at least one enemy district that can be destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if the Armory can be used, false otherwise

      • useArmoryAbility

        public void useArmoryAbility()
        Activates the Armory's ability. This removes the Armory from your city and destroys a destroyable district in another player's city for free.

      • getArmoryDestroyableDistrictIndexes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getArmoryDestroyableDistrictIndexes(Player target)
        Gets the list of indexes of districts in the target's city that can be destroyed using the Armory.
        Parameters:
        target - the player whose districts to check
        Returns:
        list of destroyable district indexes

      • destroyDistrict

        public void destroyDistrict(Player target,
                            int districtIndex,
                            boolean free)
        Destroys a district in the target player's city. May be free (e.g., from Armory) or require gold (Warlord).
        Specified by:
        destroyDistrict in class Player
        Parameters:
        target - the player whose district is being destroyed
        districtIndex - the index of the district to destroy
        free - whether the destruction is free

      • hasDestroyableDistricts

        public boolean hasDestroyableDistricts(Player target)
        Checks whether the target player has any destroyable districts.
        Parameters:
        target - the player to check
        Returns:
        true if any of the districts can be destroyed

      • getDestroyableDistrictIndexes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDestroyableDistrictIndexes(Player target)
        Returns the list of indexes of destroyable districts for a target player.
        Parameters:
        target - the player to check
        Returns:
        list of destroyable district indexes

      • canArmoryDestroyDistrict

        public boolean canArmoryDestroyDistrict(Player target,
                                        int districtIndex)
        Checks if a district at the given index can be destroyed by the Armory. Cannot destroy 'Keep', and city must have less than limit (7 or 8).
        Parameters:
        target - the target player
        districtIndex - the index of the district
        Returns:
        true if destroyable by Armory

      • shouldWarlordDestroyThisTurn

        public boolean shouldWarlordDestroyThisTurn()
        Determines whether the Warlord should attempt to destroy a district this turn. Uses basic strategy depending on round and affordability.
        Returns:
        true if the Warlord should destroy a district

      • chooseBestPlayerToDestroy

        public Player chooseBestPlayerToDestroy()
        Chooses the best player to target for destruction based on a scoring heuristic. Uses different strategies depending on whether it's the final round.
        Returns:
        the chosen target player

      • chooseBestPlayerToDestroyViaArmory

        public Player chooseBestPlayerToDestroyViaArmory()
        Chooses the best target player for the Armory's destruction effect. Prioritises players with the largest cities (if final round), or scores based on number of destroyable districts and presence of purple cards.
        Returns:
        the best target player, or null if none found

      • chooseBestDistrictToDestroyFromIndexes

        public int chooseBestDistrictToDestroyFromIndexes(Player target,
                                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> indexes)
        Chooses the best district to destroy from a given list of indexes. Purple cards are prioritised, then cost.
        Parameters:
        target - the player whose city is being checked
        indexes - the indexes of districts that can be destroyed
        Returns:
        the index of the best district to destroy, or -1 if none

      • isFinalRound

        public boolean isFinalRound()
        Checks if it's the final round of the game.
        Returns:
        true if the current round is the final round

      • chooseCharacter

        public CharacterCard chooseCharacter(java.util.List<CharacterCard> available)
        AI logic for choosing the best character card to play this round. Evaluates based on hand size, gold, city status and known strengths of characters.
        Specified by:
        chooseCharacter in class Player
        Parameters:
        available - list of characters to choose from
        Returns:
        the best character card to play

      • buildDistrict

        public void buildDistrict()
        Chooses and builds one or more districts from hand based on score. Repeats while there's a card worth building.
        Specified by:
        buildDistrict in class Player

      • onDistrictBuilt

        protected void onDistrictBuilt(DistrictCard newlyBuiltDistrict)
        Triggers effects when a district is built. Specifically implements Lighthouse ability for AI.
        Overrides:
        onDistrictBuilt in class Player
        Parameters:
        newlyBuiltDistrict - the district that was just built

      • chooseIncome

        public void chooseIncome(Deck districtDeck)
        Chooses whether to take 2 gold or draw cards, based on a score system. Accounts for character ability, hand size, and special buildings.
        Overrides:
        chooseIncome in class Player
        Parameters:
        districtDeck - the district card districtDeck to draw from
